title: The Kahala Hotel & Resort Appoints New Managers in Leisure SalesTravelandtourworld.com
text:
The Kahala Hotel & Resort Appoints New Managers in Leisure Sales
The Kahala Hotel & Resort has appointed both Jacob Keana‘āina and Beverly Guiang to the position of travel industry sales manager. Both will be responsible for overseeing sales for O‘ahu’s premier luxury resort with Keana‘āina handling retail agencies and travel agents in Australia and New Zealand, and Guiang handling domestic and international wholesale and corporate accounts in North America.
“Both Jacob and Beverly bring high energy and interpersonal skills to the team, adding a new dimension of service to our clients,” said The Kahala Hotel & Resort Director of Sales Roger Bright. “We look forward to the both of them enhancing our sales initiatives and raising awareness for The Kahala in key regions and emerging markets.”
Keana‘āina joined The Kahala Hotel & Resort as sales coordinator in September 2014 before being promoted to travel industry sales manager. Prior to joining the resort, he spent five years at the Honolulu division of Hotelbeds USA, a global travel distribution partner of online accommodations and ancillary products, where he held positions of groups and weddings coordinator, yield analyst and contract executive – destination services. Born and raised in Kailua-Kona, Keana‘āina graduated from Kealakehe High School in 2004, and earned a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration with emphasis on Tourism Industry Management from Hawaii Pacific University.
Prior to joining The Kahala Hotel & Resort, Guiang served as sales manager at Ihilani Resort & Spa, where she joined in 2010 when the resort was under the management of JW Marriott Hotels & Resorts. Prior to this, she held positions of store manager and assistant store manager/women’s buyer at Blue Hawaii Surf. Born and raised in Waipahu, she is a graduate of Waipahu High School and holds a bachelor’s degree in Travel Industry Management from University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa and associate’s degree in Teaching from Leeward Community College.
Source:- Kahala Hotel & Resort
